config.question: Which of the following measures set up under Franklin Roosevelt was associated with providing jobs to the unemployed?

answer_3.response: The final commitment to the idea of work relief came in 1935 when Roosevelt established the Works Progress Administration (WPA) to spend nearly $5 billion authorized by Congress for emergency relief. The WPA put the unemployed on the federal payroll, so they could earn enough to meet their basic needs and stimulate the stagnant economy.
